tags: adventures of ser mom and ser dad and their dumbass northern kids
summary:
Sansa, on the phone: Mumma, we got a problem. 
Brienne: Oh no. 
*Arya snatching the phone from Sansa*
Arya: Before you get mad...
body:
Sansa, on the phone: Mumma, we got a problem.

Brienne: Oh no.

*Arya snatching the phone from Sansa*

Arya: Before you get mad just remember, with great boredom comes great irresponsibility.

Brienne: Please tell me you didn’t put Bran on the roof again.

Bran in the background: *distant cawing sounds*

Arya: He likes to pretend he’s a bird. You know this.

Brienne: WHERE IS YOUR FATHER?!

Jaime in the background: Hey guys! I bet you won’t dare me to backflip off this roof!

Brienne: I’m coming home. Go ahead and call 911 when we hang up.

summary: Hi. I came late to the fandom but I really like Jaqarya so I want to know are you going to stay on tumblr now when the show is...
question: Hi. I came late to the fandom but I really like Jaqarya so I want to know are you going to stay on tumblr now when the show is over?
answer:
Hello dear anon! 

I’m definitely staying. I might not be very active all the time but I’m not going anywhere. I think there will be more Jaqarya blogs when The Winds of Winter are published. Jaqen was immensely popular after season 2 but for some reason D&D couldn’t stand it so they completely changed his character. Many people still love Jaqen thanks to Tom Wlaschiha’s incredible talent but lots of people feel betrayed by the showrunners. There are so many fantastic season 2 Jaqen edits on tumblr, people were shipping Arya and Jaqen like crazy back then. The shippers will come back, especially knowing that Gendrya is not happening. So stay tuned if you like Jaqarya and thank you for showing love for this awesome ship! <3

title: 175/2019 iBoy
body:
175/2019 iBoy - ficção científica gangster adolescente inglesa da Netflix boazinha

Ainda na minha pesquisa na Netflix achei esse filminho perperdido, iBoy, de 2017.

Em princípio iBoy é um filme teen bem violento e estranho.

Depois ele parece ser um filme de super herói ou de super vilão, como queira, disfarçado, tipo um Brightburn da periferia de Londres.

iBoy é tudo isso, mas é principalmente um filme sobre a vida estúpida que os moleques dessa periferia vivem, um…

View On WordPress

blog.name: bonesgadh
blog.title: Another Arya Stark Stan
blog.description: Just a girl who is obsessed with many things: Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Bones, Pitch Perfect, La La Land, Desperate Housewives, Stranger Things, Friends, HIMYM, Orange Is The New Black, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, The Hunger Games. Cheese addict. Dog lover. Disney and Pixar crazy fan. Pretty decent cook. 🇲🇽. Proud Gryffindor. Broadway Freak. Drummer. I write stuff, mostly fanfiction. Rey Solo theorist. I love all sports. Main ships: Booth & Brennan, Gendrya, Ross & Rachel, Jeca, Everlark, Merder, Mileven, Damerey, Harmione. I have a slightly unhealthy obsession with Julie Andrews and I love John Williams beyond all things. Current state: waiting for Stranger Things 3.

summary: Glad to know I wasn’t the only one who thought Arya showing no signs of ptsd after surviving what happened in kings landing was...
question: Glad to know I wasn’t the only one who thought Arya showing no signs of ptsd after surviving what happened in kings landing was unrealistic 🙄
answer:
Yeah, it was one of the many things that bothered me about the finale. I mean she was a bit shocked during the horse scene and when she talked to Jon but it wasn’t enough, not for a person who had just survived the medieval fantasy equivalent of a war bombing.

Arya saw people being burned alive, horrible mutilations and injuries, she was almost suffocated to death, three buildings colapsed around her and almost crushed her, she escaped Drogon’s fire by bare millimeters, the mother and child she tried to save died without her being able to do anything. These are the kind of things that scar you for life and I don’t think I’m exaggerating when I say that was the worst experience of her life, I highly doubt she’ll ever live something as horrible as that.

I wanted her to be shell shocked, to cry and to emotionally collapse. That would have been very realistic and it would have shown us Arya’s most vulnerable side, another confirmation of her being done with death and embracing humanity and life once and for all.

summary: So winterfell had bran who liked to climb stuff to dangerous heights for no apparent reason, Arya being a feisty little girl and...
body:
So winterfell had bran who liked to climb stuff to dangerous heights for no apparent reason, Arya being a feisty little girl and also fighting with Sansa a lot including stuffing her mattress full of sheep shit, Jon just brooding all over the place, plus Robb, Theon, and rickon to contend with…

Props to catelyn and Ned for getting (most of) them to at least adulthood alive

blog.name: secretlyatargaryen
blog.title: Worms are crawling in and out of Rhaegar's ass
blog.description: Jenny. This blog consists mainly of Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire, with particular focus on Tyrion, but also among my favorites are Sansa, Cersei, Arya, and Brienne. I also occasionally post about video games or books or whatever else I find interesting.

summary: I was browsing some of your asoiaf, and was curious about something you said about Cat and Sansa being the favorite children. I...
question: I was browsing some of your asoiaf, and was curious about something you said about Cat and Sansa being the favorite children. I can understand why you would think Cat was her dad's favorite, but I'm confused about Sansa's inclusion. Why do you think Sansa is Ned or even Cat's favorite child? To me, Sansa is the easy child. It's like that old saying: "The squeaky wheel gets the oil". She met their expectations,so they left her alone. They had other more rebellious children to worry about.
answer:
I kinda had a feeling I would get a comment about this because I know there’s Discourse over the idea that Sansa didn’t get enough attention from her parents or was treated unfairly in favor of Arya, and I think that comes from Sansa’s own feelings of jealousy over Arya getting attention and her anxiety about being the perfect child. But that is very much a “favored child” thing, needing to be the favored child all the time. I think she was the easy child and she was often praised for that and expected to be that. She’s also the firstborn girl in her family, which makes her special in the eyes of her parents and adds an additional need that she fit the social expectations of a girl, and since she excelled at that she was favored in that respect. That doesn’t mean I think she necessarily got more attention than any of the others, and I mean, it’s not a competition so Idk why some people are trying to make it one where Sansa is Most Neglected or something. I compared her to Catelyn thinking that her father loved her best because she always did her duty, because Sansa WAS favored in that respect, and I think Sansa had the same mindset, that if she always did what she was supposed to then her parents would love her the best, which had the side effect of creating a complex where she always NEEDED to live up to other people’s expectations, and both Catelyn and Sansa have that problem. They are also both the eldest girl in their family so I think that added to the conception that they needed to be special.

I think she was favored in some ways and neglected in others and I think that does do damage that is reflected in her pov. And, I mean, this is how patriarchy works, it’s a double-edged sword where women are cut no matter what they do. But Arya was the same way, although in different ways. Both of them suffered from the way society treats girls. Sansa was favored and praised for her ability to conform to societal expectations:

“Sansa was a lady at three, always so courteous and eager to please. She loved nothing so well as tales of knightly valor. Men would say she had my look, but she will grow into a woman far more beautiful than I ever was, you can see that. I often sent away her maid so I could brush her hair myself. She had auburn hair, lighter than mine, and so thick and soft … the red in it would catch the light of the torches and shine like copper.”

This quote shows that not only was Sansa praised for being beautiful and ladylike, but she received special personal attention from her parents because of it. Which is precisely why Sansa gets jealous when Arya receives attention despite and sometimes because of not living up to expectations. I think Sansa had higher expectations placed on her and so she would be held to a higher expectation, which is why she gets upset when Ned praises Arya for picking wildflowers and getting dirty, for instance, something that if Sansa did, she would probably be scolded for.

We also know from both Cat and Ned and Arya and Sansa’s pov that Sansa was held up as the example for Arya to live up to many times, by her parents and by Septa Mordane. They may have left Sansa alone in terms of disciplining or teaching her because they didn’t need to, she’s the good child and she would always do what was expected of her, but she was also constantly expected to be an example, which puts pressure both on Arya and on Sansa to live up to that expectation.

I get annoyed with this sort of discourse because not only is it just another aspect of Ye Olden Arya vs Sansa Fandom War, but there seems to be this conception that if, like Sansa, girls and women do everything right and are the perfect image of femininity, there’s a way to win against the patriarchy, and it’s other people who are at fault for not appreciating Sansa’s perfectness, or whatever. You can’t win by playing their game, though. Patriarchy is set up for women to fail no matter what they do, which is why neither Arya nor Sansa won the “perfect daughter” contest, and why both ended up feeling like the other did at times.

blog.description:
belle. xix. musical theatre trash. always a slut for dark academia. i really like commas and italics.

❝ she was lovely and charming, almost a saint. she told me she enjoyed laughter and dancing, opera, jazz, and getting very, very, very high.❞

tags: the only reason i wouldn't date this queen herself is bc she's obviously married to gendry
question: arya! 💟
answer:
My love, my life, my #1 favorite character of all time, the one person who can never be matched I can’t believe I stan such an icon

looks: somewhat attractive | eh | not really my type | pretty | handsome | beautiful | stud | gorgeous | SWEET LORD MERCY

can you relate to this character on a personal level?: no | not really | somewhat | yes | they are me

would you date/be friends with this character in real life if they were real?: total bros | friends | best friends | date | become their steady boyfriend/ girlfriend | neither | i don’t kno

give me a character (from anything ever) in my ask and I’ll rate
